Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Additional Statistics Telemetry" (#7316) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Adding additional telemetry around statistics in gallery.
Adds metrics for the following:
Interceptor replaces a gallery values with a smaller values from downloads for package
Interceptor replaces a gallery values with a smaller values from downloads for package registration
Request to get stats for package fails
Request to get stats for package registration fails
Duration of downloads.v1.json refresh
Update of downloads.v1.json causes a decrease in download count.

Also rejects updates to internal download count in service if it would lower the download count of a package.

@cristinamanum

Opened issue "Rule: dll in lib/<tfm>/ is compatible with that TFM" (#8297) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Please read the following information before posting the issue.

## Before posting the issue...

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues)
* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place.

Remove the content above here and fill out details below.

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1.

2.

...

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Opened issue "The installed/updates tabs in the PM UI can share a data source" (#8294) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This is a perf improvement. 

Each of tabs can also have its own datasource to avoid reloading when switching across the tabs.

Opened issue "Test:  end-to-end tests sometimes fail with NuGet assembly load failures on VS launch" (#8292) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "'error NU5000 - Nuspec file does not exist in package' should either identify the package or reinstall it" (#8291) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

dotnet.exe --version: 3.0.100-preview5-011568

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a .csproj

2. Add a PackageReference to something not bundled with the .net sdk (e.g. ````<PackageReference Include="NUnit" Version="3.12.0" />````)

3. `dotnet restore`

4. Delete the .nuspec file for the package from the packages cache (e.g. %userprofile%\.nuget\packages\nunit\3.12.0\nunit.3.12.0.nuspec

5. Delete the obj\ directory next to the .csproj

6. `dotnet restore`

This will produce the following error: `error NU5000: Nuspec file does not exist in package`

## Desired behavior
One of the following should happen:
1. The error should identify which package id/version/install dir is broken.
    a. Otherwise the error is nearly inactionable without clearing the entire packages cache
2. Silently reinstall the package like would occur if the entire install dir was deleted

## Comments
* This reflects cache corruption; it is not a mainline scenario
* This is a real scenario that one of our devs encountered (though we don't know exactly how the bad state happened)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PM UI changes - unify Update/Installed tab" (#8290) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently the update/installed tabs differ in 3 ways. 

1. On the installed tab, all top level dependency are displayed.  On the updates tab, only the ones that have newer versions on the selected source(s) are displayed. 
1. The updates tabs has checkboxes that are used to allow a multi package update. 
1. The updates label has a number that says how many packages have updates. 

My proposal is to merge these 2 tabs into since so much of the information is redundant. 

1. Add a new checkbox to filter packages with updates only. 
1. Keep the checkboxes on by default (or enable it when the updates only filter is checked). 
1. Keep the label on the newly consolidated tab. 

//cc @karann-msft @anangaur Thoughts?
